description: Updates a usage plan of a given plan Id.

parameters.name: usagePlanId
parameters.description: The Id of the to-be-updated usage plan.

parameters.name: patchOperations
parameters.description: For more information about supported patch operations, see Patch Operations. (dict) --- For more information about supported patch operations, see Patch Operations. op (string) --- An update operation to be performed with this PATCH request. The valid value can be add, remove, replace or copy. Not all valid operations are supported for a given resource. Support of the operations depends on specific operational contexts. Attempts to apply an unsupported operation on a resource will return an error message.. path (string) --- The op operation's target, as identified by a JSON Pointer value that references a location within the targeted resource. For example, if the target resource has an updateable property of {'name':'value'}, the path for this property is /name. If the name property value is a JSON object (e.g., {'name': {'child/name': 'child-value'}}), the path for the child/name property will be /name/child~1name. Any slash ('/') character appearing in path names must be escaped with '~1', as shown in the example above. Each op operation can have only one path associated with it. value (string) --- The new target value of the update operation. It is applicable for the add or replace operation. When using AWS CLI to update a property of a JSON value, enclose the JSON object with a pair of single quotes in a Linux shell, e.g., --{'a': --¦}'. from (string) --- The copy update operation's source as identified by a JSON-Pointer value referencing the location within the targeted resource to copy the value from. For example, to promote a canary deployment, you copy the canary deployment ID to the affiliated deployment ID by calling a PATCH request on a Stage resource with 'op':'copy', 'from':'/canarySettings/deploymentId' and 'path':'/deploymentId'.

Not all valid operations are supported for a given resource. Support of the operations depends on specific operational contexts. Attempts to apply an unsupported operation on a resource will return an error message..

nested_items.name: id
nested_items.description: The identifier of a UsagePlan resource.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of a usage plan.

nested_items.name: description
nested_items.description: The description of a usage plan.

nested_items.name: apiStages
nested_items.description: The associated API stages of a usage plan.

nested_items.name: apiId
nested_items.description: API Id of the associated API stage in a usage plan.

nested_items.name: stage
nested_items.description: API stage name of the associated API stage in a usage plan.

nested_items.name: burstLimit
nested_items.description: The API target request burst rate limit. This allows more requests through for a period of time than the target rate limit.

nested_items.name: rateLimit
nested_items.description: The API target request rate limit.

nested_items.name: burstLimit
nested_items.description: The API target request burst rate limit. This allows more requests through for a period of time than the target rate limit.

nested_items.name: rateLimit
nested_items.description: The API target request rate limit.

nested_items.name: limit
nested_items.description: The target maximum number of requests that can be made in a given time period.

nested_items.name: offset
nested_items.description: The number of requests subtracted from the given limit in the initial time period.

nested_items.name: period
nested_items.description: The time period in which the limit applies. Valid values are 'DAY', 'WEEK' or 'MONTH'.

nested_items.name: productCode
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Marketplace product identifier to associate with the usage plan as a SaaS product on the Amazon Web Services Marketplace.
